headline: 'Block Everything' protesters clash with police on French PM's first day
subhead: The Interior Ministry said 197,000 people took part in the protests around the country, while the CGT union claimed the number was 250,000. Authorities said 540 arrests had been made by the late afternoon.

headline: France's best art exhibitions this fall, in Paris and beyond
subhead: Here is Le Monde's selection of must-see art exhibitions, from painter John Singer Sargent to medieval forgeries to contemporary Nigerian artist Otobong Nkanga, which will go on display through the end of the year.

headline: Pro-Palestinian protesters in the UK face trial for alleged support for terrorism

headline: 'Block Everything': While September 10 movement echoes the Yellow Vests, it also has key differences
subhead: While the call to 'block everything' on Wednesday, September 10, brings to mind the Yellow Vest protests of 2018, the choice of a weekday, the involvement of unions, and the support of left-wing parties give this social movement its own distinct character.

headline: Behind the 'Block Everything' movement: Tight budgets and fear about the future
subhead: The surge in inflation in recent years is still being felt, fueling frustration among France's 'just-getting-by' population. Falling unemployment has not stopped the poverty rate from rising.
